intro: Dasylepis seretii, commonly known as the Seretii grass. It is a flowering plant native to Madagascar, belonging to the Poaceae family. The plant is characterized by its tufted growth habit and narrow, grass-like leaves. It produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, white or pale blue flowers. Dasylepis seretii is often found in rocky or coastal habitats and is adapted to arid conditions.
